title: Update Your Phone Number on Amazon: Easy Steps + Quick Fixes

steps.title: Open the Amazon app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Amazon app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. It's the brown icon with a black arrow and blue tab on your Home screen or in your app list. If you don't have the Amazon app on your phone or tablet, it's easy to install from the App Store (iPhone/iPad) or Play Store (Android). If you're unable to sign in because you've set up two-step verification with your old phone number, see the Troubleshooting method for account recovery steps.

steps.title: Tap the profile icon.
steps.content: Tap the profile icon. It's the outline of a person at the bottom of the screen.

steps.title: Tap Your Account.
steps.content: Tap Your Account . You'll see this button in the upper-left area of the menu. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Login & security.
steps.content: Tap Login & security . This option is just below the "Account settings" header.

steps.title: Sign in and confirm your identity.
steps.content: Sign in and confirm your identity. Before you can change your phone number, you will need to confirm either your old mobile number or email address. Amazon will send a verification link to both your email address and old phone number, just in case you can't access one or the other. If you still have access to your old phone number, tap the link in the SMS message from Amazon and select Approve . If not, open the email message from Amazon and choose Approve there. If you can no longer access your old phone number and your email account, see this method for recovery instructions. Once approved, return to the Amazon app. You'll now see a list of information you can edit.

steps.title: Tap Edit next to "Mobile Phone number."
steps.content: Tap Edit next to "Mobile Phone number." It'll be near the middle of the menu.

steps.title: Enter your new phone number and tap Continue.
steps.content: Enter your new phone number and tap Continue . You will receive a text message to your new phone number that contains a verification code.

steps.title: Enter the verification code and tap Verify.
steps.content: Enter the verification code and tap Verify . This connects your new phone number to your Amazon account.

steps.title: Update the phone number connected to your shipping address (optional).
steps.content: Update the phone number connected to your shipping address (optional). If you have a new phone number, you'll want to make sure that your old number is no longer associated with the shipping address you use to order products on Amazon. To check: Tap the profile icon at the bottom and select Your Account . Tap Your Addresses under the "Account settings" header. If you see the wrong phone number on an address, tap Edit below the address that contains the incorrect phone number. Tap the "Phone number" field to place the cursor, delete the current phone number, and enter a new one. Scroll down to the bottom and tap Save changes .

steps.title: Sign in to https://www.amazon.com in a web browser.
steps.content: Sign in to https://www.amazon.com in a web browser. If you're not already signed in, click Sign In at the top-right corner to log in with your Amazon account . If you're unable to sign in because you've set up two-step verification with your old phone number, see the Troubleshooting method for account recovery steps.

steps.title: Hover your mouse over Accounts & Lists.
steps.content: Hover your mouse over Accounts & Lists . A drop-down menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Account near the top of the menu.
steps.content: Click Account near the top of the menu.

steps.title: Click Login & security.
steps.content: Click Login & security . It's the second tile at the top of the page.

steps.title: Sign in and confirm your identity.
steps.content: Sign in and confirm your identity. In most cases, Amazon will send a verification link to both your email address and cell phone number on file before allowing you to change your phone number. If you still have access to your old phone number, you can tap the link in the SMS message from Amazon and select Approve to approve the login. If not, check your email. Open the message from Amazon and click or tap Approve . If you can't access both the phone number and email address associated with your account, see Troubleshooting for recovery steps.

steps.title: Click Edit next to "Mobile Phone number."
steps.content: Click Edit next to "Mobile Phone number." This allows you to make changes to the mobile phone number connected to your account.

steps.title: Enter your new mobile phone number and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your new mobile phone number and click Continue . You will receive a text message that contains a verification code.

steps.title: Enter the verification code and click Verify.
steps.content: Enter the verification code and click Verify . This connects your new phone number to your Amazon account.

steps.title: Change the phone number associated with a shipping address (optional).
steps.content: Change the phone number associated with a shipping address (optional). If you have a new phone number, you'll want to make sure that your old number is no longer associated with the shipping address you use to order products on Amazon. To check: Hover your cursor over Accounts & Lists at the top-right corner and select Account . Click Your Addresses in the "Ordering and shopping preferences" box. If the wrong phone number appears on any shipping addresses, click Edit under the address, update your phone number, and click Save Changes .

steps.title: Can't receive the verification link so you can update your phone number?
steps.content: Can't receive the verification link so you can update your phone number? If you can't update your phone number because you've lost access to your old phone number and email address, contact Amazon Customer Service by phone. [2] X Research source A customer service agent will help you restore access to your account so you can update your phone number and email address. In the US and Canada, call 1-800-388-5512. Internationally, dial 206-577-1364. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Can't sign in because you set up two-step verification with your old phone number?
steps.content: Can't sign in because you set up two-step verification with your old phone number? You can recover your account by uploading a clear photo or scan of a government-issued identification card, such as your driver's license or passport, to Amazon for verification. When taking the photo, make sure your name, address, and the issuing authority is visible in the photo. If you want, you can cover personal information like social security or account numbers. [4] X Research source Once you have a photo, go to https://www.amazon.com/a/recover/upload in a web browser and confirm your email address (or phone number) and password. Upload the photo and other requested information from Amazon. Once submitted, allow Amazon 1-2 days to verify your identification. You will receive further instructions via email once your identify is verified. Once you've recovered your account, you can easily change your phone number on your computer or using the mobile app .
